data.event: Incorporated on December 21, 1906, Coldstream celebrated its centennial in 2006.
Incorporated on December 21, 1906, Coldstream celebrated its centennial in 2006.
Coldstream is best known for the Coldstream Ranch, established in 1863 by Captain Charles Frederick Houghton.

event.title: transferred the ranch to Forbes G. and Charles Albert Vernon who in 1891

data.event: He transferred the ranch to Forbes G. and Charles Albert Vernon who in 1891 sold it to John Hamilton-Gordon, 1st Marquess of Aberdeen and Temair, future Governor General of Canada (1893â€“1898).

event.title: was purchased by its current owners in 1994

data.event: The ranch was purchased by its current owners in 1994 and continues to be a working cattle ranch.

event.title: retail trade and services are now

data.event: However, manufacturing, retail trade and services are now the primary industries.
